column1: On [[30 August]] [[1964]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
column2: a letter]] to [[L. Sprague de Camp]]'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG

column1: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien writes about his opinion of the contributions to the anthology ''[[Swords & Sorcery]]''.
*'''Publication:''' Quotes from the letter were published in [[Mythlore 50

column2: all the items seem poor in the subsidiary (but to me not unimportant) matters of nomenclature. Best when inventive, least good when literary or archaic

column1: *[[Critique of "Distressing Tale of Thangobrind the Jeweler"]]
